result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry J. Miller Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.   In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt. Restitution is Joint/Several with Gary Phelps.

The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with M. Marks as named in the complaint. Contact with Faith Peterson to be determined by Supervising Agent.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 13FA88.  All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant is to keep a valid address with Waushara County Child Support and the Waushara County Clerk of Court.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

records.addlTxt:
9:19 am cases called-14CF190, 15CF9, 15CF126, 16CF114, & 13FA88. Defendant Larry J. Miller in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Larry J. Miller in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding status. Attorney Rashid makes statement and global resolution reached.   Agreement stated on the record by DA Blader. State will move to amend Count 1 of 14CF190 to Receiving/Concealing Stolen Property-PTAC in violation of 943.34(1)(bm). Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts amendment of Count 1 of 14CF190 as motioned by the State.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 of 14CF190, No Contest to Count 1 of 15CF9, No Contest to Count 1 of 15CF126, & No Contest to Counts 1 & 2 of 16CF114.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 14CF190 & dismisses the repeater enhancer on Count 1 of 14CF190, Dismiss & read in Counts 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 of 15CF126, & Counts 3, 4, 5, & 6 of 16CF114. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Rashid. Statement by the defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing.  Court sentences the defendant to: 
14CF190- 6 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 3 years Initial Confinement & 3 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 252 days Served. 
15CF9- SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. Consecutive to 14CF190.
16CF114-SWD and places on probation for a period of 4 years. Concurrent to 14CF190.
CONDITIONS OF ES & Probation: AODA and follow through, Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with M. Marks as named in the complaint. Contact with Faith Peterson to be determined by Supervising Agent. Full time employment. Working address with Child Support and Clerk of Courts. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Restitution of $1,360.00 to be paid joint & several with Gary Phelps. DOC authorization for restitution and costs. Defendant to make timely payments of child support as ordered in 13FA88.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Court finds the defendant eligible for CIP & SAP. 
15CF126- Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan to include injunction filing fee. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
